com.groupon.mapreduce.mongo.in
Class MongoInputFormat

java.lang.Object
  
      com.groupon.mapreduce.mongo.in.MongoInputFormat

public class MongoInputFormat
extends

This InputFormat reads Records from files in the Mongo on-disk binary format. It requires the location in the FileSystem of these files, and a Mongo DB/Collection to look for in this directory. It expects to see dbname.ns and dbname.0, with more data in dbname.i, where i is an integer increasing from 0. Using these files, it creates InputSplits with Mongo Extents.

MongoInputFormat

public MongoInputFormat()
Method Detail

setMongoDirectory

public static void setMongoDirectory(Path path_)
Set the directory to search for Mongo files, which should be in one or more directories within the given directory. In other words for a Mongo DB at hdfs://host/mongo/host1/db.ns, pass in "/mongo/host1".

Parameters:
path_ - Path given to MongoInputFormat to search for extents

setDatabase

public static void setDatabase(java.lang.String database_)
Set the database to MapReduce over. For example, if hdfs://host/mongo/host1/db.ns exists, enter "db".

Parameters:
database_ - Name of database over which you want to Map

setCollection

public static void setCollection(java.lang.String collection_)
Collection over which you want to mapreduce. This should be a member of the database passed in with setDatabase().

Parameters:
collection_ - Name of the collection over which you want to Map

getSplits

public java.util.List<InputSplit> getSplits(JobContext jobContext)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            java.lang.InterruptedException
This is required by InputFormat, and returns a list of InputSplits found by searching in the given directory for Mongo data.

Parameters:
